result.execSummary:
The defendant Latanga N. Travis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: **JOC amended to add restitution information on 1-27-15 **

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $1502   plus surcharges.   
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Bernice Feduzkowski, unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

State appears by Special Prosecutor Thaddeus McGuire.  Agent Mathieson appears in court.  The defendant does not appear.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Agent Mathieson states that the defendant is in New Jersey and is on interstate compact.  The agent does not believe that the the defendant has made a good faith effort to pay the court ordered financial obligations.  The court extends probation for a period of one year.  Order signed in court.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Latanga N. Travis, appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Counts 1 & 3 - Sentence is withheld; Deft. placed on probation for 3 years with conditions concurrent.  As a condition court imposes 30 days in the KCJ commencing on 1/31/15 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.  Restitution is ordered in the amount of $1,502.00.  No contact with Bernice F.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Latanga N. Travis, appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.   Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Counts 1 & 3 - Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2, 4 & 5 are Dismissed and Read In.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 1/15/15 at 10:30 AM.
